citeinfo.origin: PRISM Climate Group at Oregon State University
citeinfo.title: PRISM 4km mesh for the conterminous US (polygon shapefile)

pubinfo.publish: PRISM Climate Group at Oregon State University

descript.abstract: This dataset represents a PRISM 4km (2.5 arc-minute) polygon mesh for the conterminous US (CONUS). Each polygon in the shapefile corresponds to a PRISM 4km grid cell. PRISM 4km grid cells were converted to polygons, retaining as attributes the column, row, and coordinate (lat/lon) information corresponding to grid cell centers. This polygon mesh contains all grid cells contained within the PRISM 4km CONUS extent.
descript.purpose: Provide a continuous polygon mesh GIS layer representing the footprint of all PRISM 4km grid cells in the CONUS extent.

idinfo.useconst: Acknowledgement of the following agencies in products derived from these data: PRISM Climate Group at Oregon State University.

attracc.attraccr: Similar quality assurance procedures were used with all input data sets.

dataqual.logic: PRISM 4km grid cells were converted to a polygon mesh, retaining the column, row, and coordinate (lat/lon) information as attributes corresponding to grid cell centers. Detailed PRISM dataset information is available at https://www.prism.oregonstate.edu/documents/PRISM_datasets.pdf.
dataqual.complete: This dataset is considered complete. Please view the logic section of this document for further information.

horizpa.horizpar: Accuracy of this data set is based on the original specification of the Defense Mapping Agency (DMA) 1 degree digital elevation models (DEM). The stated accuracy of the original DEMs are 130 m circular error with 90% probability.

citeinfo.title: PRISM 4km mesh for the conterminous US (polygon shapefile)

srcinfo.srccontr: Please view the logic section of this document for further information.

procstep.procdesc: This dataset was created to represent the PRISM 4km (2.5 arc-minute) grid cell as a polygon mesh. Please view the abstract section of this document for more information.

enttyp.enttypl: PRISM 4km mesh for the conterminous US
enttyp.enttypd: Polygons representing PRISM 4km (2.5 arc-minute) grid cells
enttyp.enttypds: [1] Daly, C., Halbleib, M., Smith, J.I., Gibson, W.P., Doggett, M.K., Taylor, G.H., Curtis, J., and Pasteris, P.A. 2008. Physiographically-sensitive mapping of temperature and precipitation across the conterminous United States. International Journal of Climatology, 28: 2031-2064. doi:10.1002/joc.1688 [2] Daly, C., J.I. Smith, and K.V. Olson. 2015. Mapping atmospheric moisture climatologies across the conterminous United States. PloS ONE 10(10):e0141140. doi:10.1371/journal.pone.0141140 [3] Daly, C., M.K. Doggett, J.I. Smith, K.V. Olson, M.D. Halbleib, Z. Dimcovic, D. Keon, R.A. Loiselle, B. Steinberg, A.D. Ryan, C.M. Pancake, and E.M. Kaspar. 2021. Challenges in observation-based mapping of daily precipitation across the conterminous United States. Journal of Atmospheric and Oceanic Technology 38(11): 1979-1992. doi:10.1175/JTECH-D-21-0054.1 [4] Rupp, D.E., C. Daly, M.K. Doggett, J.I. Smith, and B. Steinberg. 2022. Mapping an observation-based global solar irradiance climatology across the conterminous United States. Journal of Applied Meteorology and Climatology 61(7): 857-876. doi:10.1175/JAMC-D-21-0236.1
